trans-unit.source: The following sections offer troubleshooting tips for API operations:
trans-unit.target: The following sections offer troubleshooting tips for API operations:

trans-unit.source: The development environment supports the use of the Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0 Failed Request Tracing feature to log information about requests.
trans-unit.target: The development environment supports the use of the Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0 Failed Request Tracing feature to log information about requests.

trans-unit.source: Failed Request Tracing produces detailed trace logs according to filters established within a web role’s configuration.
trans-unit.target: Failed Request Tracing produces detailed trace logs according to filters established within a web role’s configuration.

trans-unit.source: Windows Azure outputs trace log files to the default IIS directory for failed request logs.
trans-unit.target: Windows Azure outputs trace log files to the default IIS directory for failed request logs.

trans-unit.source: Each web role must enable tracing by using rules placed in the project's web.config file.
trans-unit.target: Each web role must enable tracing by using rules placed in the project's web.config file.

trans-unit.source: To enable tracing, place the following in the <languageKeyword>system.webServer</languageKeyword> section of your web.config file:
trans-unit.target: To enable tracing, place the following in the <languageKeyword>system.webServer</languageKeyword> section of your web.config file:

trans-unit.source: To disable tracing, remove this section from the web.config file.
trans-unit.target: To disable tracing, remove this section from the web.config file.

trans-unit.source: Every request made against the storage services returns a response header named <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Every request made against the storage services returns a response header named <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: This header contains an opaque value that uniquely identifies the request.
trans-unit.target: This header contains an opaque value that uniquely identifies the request.

trans-unit.source: If a request is consistently failing and you have verified that the request is properly formulated, you may use this value to report the error to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: If a request is consistently failing and you have verified that the request is properly formulated, you may use this value to report the error to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: In your report, include the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference>, the approximate time that the request was made, the storage service against which the request was made, and the type of operation that the request attempted.
trans-unit.target: In your report, include the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-request-id</parameterReference>, the approximate time that the request was made, the storage service against which the request was made, and the type of operation that the request attempted.
